front: Match the following configuration modes with their corresponding descriptions:
back:
Global Configuration Mode → Allows configuration changes that affect the operation of the device as a whole
Line Configuration Mode → Used to configure console, SSH, Telnet, or AUX access to the device
Interface Configuration Mode → Used to configure a switch port or router network interface settings

pairs.right: Allows configuration changes that affect the operation of the device as a whole
Used to configure console, SSH, Telnet, or AUX access to the device
Used to configure a switch port or router network interface settings

front: Match the command with the function it performs in Cisco IOS:
back:
`enable` → Command used to move from user EXEC mode to privileged EXEC mode
`configure terminal` → Command used to move from privileged EXEC mode to global configuration mode
`exit` → Command used to return to privileged EXEC mode from global configuration mode
`end` → Command used to move from any subconfiguration mode to privileged EXEC mode

pairs.right: Command used to move from user EXEC mode to privileged EXEC mode
Command used to move from privileged EXEC mode to global configuration mode
Command used to return to privileged EXEC mode from global configuration mode
Command used to move from any subconfiguration mode to privileged EXEC mode
